122222222113122221121132313333213332.content:
Standing in the door is a tall Asian woman, possibly the tallest you've ever seen. Standing roughly six feet tall in flats and a sharp, gray business suit, you recognize what must be Sora's mother - her birth mother, Tien - based on that description alone, not to mention the way Sora panics when she sees her. Immediately setting you down on the table, jerking her hand away like you're a hot potato and hiding it in her lap, she suddenly goes stiff as a deer in headlights as she starts to babble.

"M-mom!" Sora stammers out hastily, looking panicky as her gaze goes back and forth between you, the door, the dip bowls, and the door again. "Th- uh, this is Stevie. I mean, Steven. I, I found him when I lost my phone earlier. In the gutter. Uh. He's... been helping me with my homework..." Sora's mother stares at her with what seems like abject confusion, as if that hadn't answered her question at all.

As Sora leads with the little bit of truth she thinks her parent will most want to hear, as children do, you straighten up and step forward on the table, clearing your throat as you look up at the woman. For all Sora's obvious apparent guilt, you feel like she's most definitely overreacting to the situation.

"Steve McMinor. Nice to meet you." You call out to her, nodding politely and raising your hand in to wave. Tien's eyes go from confused to curious as they turn to you, flitting briefly behind you to the dip bowls and back. Suddenly, you realize Sora's childlike nervousness may not be entirely unfounded. While you hadn't exactly done anything wrong, yourself, there were some things about the past few days that you'd rather not have to explain to this woman... but unlike Sora, you're old enough not to immediately give it away.

"You're Mrs. Nguyen, right?" You ask, keeping it standard. "Your daughter's been taking care of me until I could get in touch with my family. Strange thing to say, at her age but it's true." You chuckle slightly, evoking a hint of a smile from the woman as she waits politely for you to finish. "Really, ma'am, Sora's a lifesaver. Literally."

You give her an honest, genuine smile as you say so, and she cracks a smile of her own in return as you see her daughter flush red out of the corner of her eye. "It's Doctor Nguyen, actually," the woman corrects you, but laughingly. She speaks without hint of an accent, having moved to the States when she was young. "But please, call me Tien. May I call you Steven? Or do you prefer Steve?" She asks, bending down to take off her flats and pick up her dropped keys.

She sets the shoes down on a rack by the door, exchanging them for some house slippers in classic Asian-parent style. "S-Steve's fine," you answer her, slightly taken aback by the familiarity. No 'Mr. McMinor', you note. Just straight to first names. Standing up, the woman turns sharply and saunters, swiftly but gracefully, to the table in front of you and Sora. Looking down at you with a corner of her mouth turned up, without leaning down, she gently puts out her hand and extends a slim, upturned finger.

"A-ah. Right, of course." Now it's your turn to stammer. Stepping forward and putting out your own arm, you cup your right hand around the extended fingertip and shake, craning your head up to make eye contact as you do so. It doesn't come easily. To say this woman towers over you is an understatement. Most people tower over you. This woman towers in general. Between her remarkable height, her straight, unbending posture, and the easy confidence in her sharp, brown eyes, you're almost not sure if you're supposed to shake her hand, or kiss it. Fact is, you've never been quite so aware that you're literally standing in someone's shadow - even more so when she surprises you by suddenly pinching your hand, firmly but gently, between her thumb and forefinger.

Now she's the one shaking. But she does so with a teasing look in her eyes that reminds you of her daughter. "I would say 'nice to meet you' also, but we've technically already met. Good to see you're doing well." She says, letting go your hand and taking her arm back. "Sora, babe, I was worried sick," she coos, suddenly one hundred percent motherly as she bends down to embrace her daughter.

Sora hugs her back, still sitting. "Sorry I lost my phone" she mumbles, sounding repentant.

"Sweetie, that's alright. Accidents. But why didn't you go ask Sunny or Mrs. Daniels to borrow theirs, and let me know?" Tien asks, still concerned but with just a hint of reprimand.

Sora shifts uncomfortably, looking away guiltily and muttering. "I- I forgot." She intones, unconvincingly. You have to frown. Was that an option the whole time? Did she actually know that all along. "Also, I forgot your numbers" she adds, as if, ironically, suddenly remembering something. Well, that's probably true. You sigh. You, on the other hand, remembered all the numbers you ever needed to call, having never had a cell phone of your own to just store them in. Well... whatever.

Tien sighs as well, apparently somewhere on the same wavelength as you are. She, too, grew up having to actually remember people's numbers sometimes. "All right. Just remember you can always do that, next time, if something happens. The Daniels have our numbers too, you know." You stand there, slightly awkward, as Sora mutters an apology and her mother shushes her, patting her on the head. "That's okay, honey. Just do better next time.

"Now, you kept up with all your lessons?" She asks, more sternly now, straightening up and lifting her daughter's chin to look her in the eyes. Sora nods earnestly in the affirmative. "Good. Glad to hear it. Especially since you had help." She flashes you a wry smile as she says this. You're both adults; you both know Sora wasn't just sitting there working on her lessons with you all day, every day. Especially since she's dressed up as a cat right now.

"Now, why don't I take a few minutes to change and come back, and you can tell me all about it while I eat?" She asks, standing up. She eyes the set of dip bowls again as she does so... cheese, oil, chocolate, and sugar. And not a hint of any chips, bread, strawberries, or anything else around.

"Oh. Of course." You answer, starting to get nervous again and trying not to let it show. Sora nods, seeming not to notice. "'kay." Tien smiles again at you, this time more knowingly, before turning to leave the room.

At the sound of her parent's bedroom door closing down the hall, you and Sora immediately jump into action, working to get your stories straight. It doesn't take long. You make her find and get out some bread and corn chips, so she'll at least know where they are when her mother comes back. There's no helping that she obviously wasn't eating any when Tien came in, but at least this way, she'll automatically know where they are, in case her mother asks for them. If she had to look around to find them first, well, it'd be quite a giveaway../

More of a problem, there's no fruit or ice cream left as a plausible excuse for the chocolate dip. If Tien asks, you'll just have to say it's what she ate the grapes with.

When Tien comes back into the kitchen, you swallow hard at the sight of her in house clothes. Nothing special. Just some gray sweatpants and a plain, white tank top, but somehow the way it hugs her slender breasts and hips makes you have to force yourself to look away, up at her face. Even then, you stare, as she tosses her short hair, tied back behind her head now, over her shoulder as she turns the corner. That year of isolation has definitely not done anything to temper your starving, teenage hormones.

"Back! Thanks for waiting." Tien's eyes meets yours as she strides cheerfully into the kitchen, seeming to register your staring. Realizing it yourself, you tear your eyes away to look at Sora instead, flushing slightly, but she doesn't mention it as she crosses the table to sit in front of you, and the dip bowls, across from Sora. Still smiling. "So. Tell me what happened." She says, voiced hushed, conspiratorially, as she leans in to slide the olive oil towards herself. "Last I heard, you disappeared more than a year ago, right? This ought to be good..."

Sora gets up and quickly fetches her mother a plate of bread, which she casually dips and snacks on as you fill her in on your time spent missing. At first, you don't tell her exactly how you ended up flushed down to the sewers, but then she asks, and you have to grudgingly explain the background. Rather than press you on the experience, however, she first just laughs and rolls her eyes at the folly of teenage partygoers, and then remarks on the impressive medical implications of your surviving the experience.

Then, Sora chimes in on how she found you, and what you'd been doing since then... with a few, key edits. Nothing about your time spent in her mouth or belly. Nor, at your insistence, as agreed upon while her mother was out changing, her food or bathtub. Just the dolls, TV, study, and 'hide-and-seek', hence Sora's currently wearing the cat pajamas.

For her part, Tien seems content mostly just to listen, rarely asking questions. Nothing like her daughter, in that respect. She does seem to go from curious, to increasingly amused, as the tale of your savage sewer life transitions into silly antics with her daughter. Still, you get the sense that she knows more than she's letting on, as she patiently listens to you go an and occasionally nibbles a bit of bread...

Does she?
122222222113122221121132313333213332.title: Meeting Her Maker

1222222221131222211211323133332133321.content:
"...anyway, that's what happened. That said, do you mind if I borrow your phone?" You finish, asking an amused-looking Tien.

"Of course." She answers easily, with a bit of a laugh. "But first, Sora dear, why don't you let me talk to Steve alone for a bit. Go clean your room, why don't you?"

"But I just did that today!" She objects, clearly not wanting to go. Tien frowns, and Sora hangs her head.

"I'll go do it again" Sora grumbles, reluctantly. "Please don't be mean to him!" She implores before hurrying away, catching you off-guard.

Tien watches her leave the room, seemingly also a bit surprised. "Well, that's sweet, isn't it?" She asks. You have to agree.

"So." Tien focuses her smiling eyes at you. "You two seem pretty close, huh?"

You hesitate. "We... get along" you answer, guarded. "But that's just kind of who she is, I think. She's a good kid. Really."

Tien nods. "Yes. She is," she agrees. She looks vaguely out into the hall, away from you. "It's not really like her to hide things from me. I have to say, I'm surprised."

Your blood runs cold. "What- what do you mean?" You ask, suddenly uncomfortable.

Tien turns to look back down at you. "Well, what I mean is, she left my camera in the bathroom. So I checked the pictures." Suddenly, her hand starts reaching out for you.

"Want to talk about it?" She asks, her tone gone suddenly...
1222222221131222211211323133332133321.title: Can't Fool Mom.

choices: ...steps out, and takes you to the living room.
...steps out, and takes you back to the kitchen.
12222222211312222112113231333321333212.content:
"Want to talk about it?" Tien asks you, her tone gone suddenly coy, teasing, as she reaches out towards you. It reminds you of her daughter's. A knowing smirk adorns her face. You're about to back away from her approaching hand, when suddenly it stops and spreads flat, landing palm-up on the table. Inviting you to step on. "Come on," she says abruptly, standing up. "Join me for a drink? I want to talk to you about something."

"I-" you hesitate, as she stands over you expectantly, holding her hand out in front of you, fearing some kind of trap. You've all but forgotten about borrowing her phone. "I'm not, uh. Old enough to drink..."

You trail off, uncertainly, recognizing the irony. You hadn't been shy about admitting your teen drinking habits before, a fact that isn't lost on her. With a curt, dismissive chuckle, she lifts her other hand up to wag a finger at you scoldingly. "Come on, Stevie." She taunts, still holding her other hand out for you. Apparently, she hadn't missed her daughter's slip-up from earlier. "Did you forget your manners while you were out in the sewers? When a pretty girl invites you for a drink, you should accept," she chides. "Otherwise, she'll feel unwanted."

Tien smirks at you some more, as you struggle to come up with an answer. Honestly, you doubt you could have sparred with this woman a year ago, and your conversational skills are, admittedly, a little rustier since.

"Besides," she adds, seeing the cat, figuratively, grasp hold your tongue, "I can't be worse than all those friends of yours. No chance you'll end up in the drink this time, promise." She adds with a wink and a grin, causing you to blush again.

Well. There's no answering that, so you just step forward onto her hand instead. Swiftly, but smoothly, it rises, bringing you up to the level of her shoulder. "That's the spirit!" Your new friend's mother chirps, starting to walk.

Willing yourself to take deep breaths, to focus, you note that for all her care and candor, she's still holding you, either deliberately or subconsciously, below her eye level. When she talks, she's talking down to you. You're looking up at her. Subtle, but not insignificant. The power dynamic is clear. Still, she seems to be taking care to step gently and hold you steadily as she moves, then stops. "How do you take your drinks?" She asks, as if it just occurred to her.

"Straight." You answer. You've never been picky.

"No." Tien shakes her head. You note the play of her ponytail around her neck and shoulders. "I mean, what do you drink it out of?"

"Oh." Fair point. You think back. "My friends had a thing we made. We took a thimble, and dipped it in candle wax. More like a bucket than a beer glass, even for me, but it worked."

"Mmm..." Tien frowns slightly, thinking. One finger of her other hand tapping against her lips, drawing your attention. "I don't have a thimble," she says, snapping you out of it all of a sudden. "Maybe a toothpaste cap, washed out?" You're surprised you hadn't thought of that earlier. "That'd work," you answer, trying not to sound impressed. "If it's washed really clean, I guess." She nods, then goes on walking out of the kitchen.

At first, you think she's taking you to the living room, where you spotted a liquor cabinet earlier... but, she's not. To your surprise and increasing anxiety, she turns the other way down the hall, and opens the door to what you assume to be the master bedroom. What's going on, here? You wonder.

Then, you see that across the room there's the door to the master bath, which lies ajar. Without commenting, Tien starts to hum as she takes you inside - a familiar tune. Last time you heard someone humming it, you realize, you were being thrown around inside her mouth as you passed through this very room. You recognize the bathroom from Sora's photoshoot. You start to fidget, which Tien notices and seems to find amusing. Holding back laughter, she sets you down on the counter, then pulls a tube of toothpaste from one of the drawers.

"Relax, would you?" She reassures you, showing you the tube and making a show of twisting the cap off.

Oh.

Sora's mom washes the toothpaste cap out for you while you watch. First with just hot water, scrubbing the grooves out with a toothbrush from the cabinet above. Is that her toothbrush? No, don't think about it. Don't be weird. Then with rubbing alcohol from the same cabinet. Then water again.

"All right, off we go?" She asks kindly, handing you the cap and then holding her hand out. You take it and step on, less nervously this time. You sniff the cap, detecting just the slightest air of mint. Well, it'll have to do. For all her teasing, it seems like the doctor's just somewhat fond of you - maybe because she studied you all those years ago, or maybe because you get along with her daughter. Who knows? In any case, she doesn't seem mad about how her daughter was playing with you.

...well, at least not so far.

Not that you were at fault for any of it, but still...

You've just about stopped worrying and started to relax, when you see her grab something off the dresser as you pass by it, en route to the bedroom door, and slip it in her pocket. The camera. She gives you another one of those wicked little teasing grins, seeing you recognize it, and coming to the bedroom door she...
12222222211312222112113231333321333212.title: Like Daughter, Like Mother

choices: Actually, she wants to hire you for something else instead?
122222222113122221121132313333213332122.content:
Moments later, you're in the living room, seated on one arm of the sofa holding your toothpaste cap. Before you have time to ask what this is about, Sora's mom deftly attaches a cable to the camera, setting it on the coffee table in front of you, then goes to the cabinet across the room to fetch a bottle of wine, glass, and corkscrew. She sits herself on the sofa next to you, setting her glass down by the camera, then pops the wine bottle open with impressive efficiency.

"So. Steve," the lady tells you warmly, in between pouring herself a glass of the purple-red liquid. "Yyyes? You wanted to talk about something?" You ask, apprehensively, as she turns on the TV to show one of Sora's selfies on the display. The first one.

Tien chuckles at the photo of Sora popping you in her mouth with every sign of entertainment, then reaches into her pocket to take out something else she grabbed from the bathroom. "You're eighteen now, right? Missed your last year of high school? I want to offer you a job." She tells you bluntly, brandishing the empty syringe. "Interested?"

You jump to your feet immediately, suddenly angry, throwing aside the toothpaste cup. "No way!" You snarl. "Thanks, but no thanks. I'm not your test subject. Can I call my parents, now?"

...

How does she react?
122222222113122221121132313333213332122.title: Just a Friendly(?) Chat Between Adults

choices: Say you need more time to think it over?
1222222221131222211211323133332133321223.content:
"Thanks, but no thanks. I'm not your test subject. Can I call my parents, now?"

...

"Huh?" Tien looks genuinely startled by your reaction, and then she realizes what she's holding. "Oh! Oh, I'm so sorry! No, not that." she apologizes profusely, setting down her glass. "No, it's for-" instead of explaining, she just dips the syringe into the wine bottle, drawing out a bit of the drink into it. "No, I want you to tutor Sora. No needle, see?" She rushes to clarify, quickly taking up the discarded toothpaste cap and filling it from the syringe, before setting them both down in front of you. "For the record, I don't do research anymore these days, anyway. I'm practicing."

"O-oh." You calm down instantly, somewhat embarrassed. "Right. Uh..." "I'll go get that phone" she jumps in, moving to leave. You stop her.

"No! That's, that's fine. Sorry."

Now that you're both feeling somewhat awkward, you fill the slightly heavy moment of silence by picking up your cap and drinking deeply as she sits back down. You're no wine aficionado, so you expect the doctor's beverage is somewhat richer than you can really appreciate, but, hey. It's not like you're wasting much. "So, uh. Tutor?" You ask awkwardly, as the bitter beverage starts warming your gut. "Why? Uh," you wave your arms disjointedly at the TV display, in which you dangle by your ankle from a costumed Sora's grinning jaws. "Because of... that??" You make no effort to hide your great confusion.

"Hah! That." Tien seems to drop her awkwardness immediately, chuckling fondly at the TV. "No. Not exactly. But if I could ask, why didn't the two of you mention it when you were filling me in earlier?"

She looks at you expectantly, but with plain curiosity instead of malice. Apparently, her daughter licking you repeatedly didn't bother her much at all... well, then again, what exactly could she have expected you to do about it? You answer frankly: "Because it's embarrassing. I'm a grown man, not a chew toy." You grimace. "Well. Except when I am. And for a given value of 'grown', but still."

Tien chuckles a little at your response. "Fair enough." She shifts into the couch cushions, letting the slippers drop from her feet and pulling them up beside her, turning sideways to face you. "I want to thank you for putting up with it. It might be a little selfish of me, but it feels good seeing her have-"

She's cut off by the TV, as the auto-play slideshow suddenly goes into video. Sora was recording!?

You cringe, watching your earlier self on screen as it looks up in tired exasperation, the little girl's tongue having just swept your other leg into her jaws. You see yourself sigh deeply as her lips purse together around your calves, pushing out gobs of spit that drip down and soak your legs and shorts. Then, with a series of wet, slurping sounds interspersed with unrestrained, childish giggling, you watch yourself get sucked up into her mouth, bit by bit, until your hands and put-upon looking face finally disappear between her lips. At this point, the camera shakes slightly as Sora poses into the mirror, making a show of swishing her morsel around, then shows off a big, exaggerated swallow. "Ahhh!" She opens wide into the mirror and sticks her tongue out, showing off how empty her mouth is - although looking closely, you can see your whole right arm sticking out from underneath her tongue, by the molars. Sora closes her mouth with a slight giggle, smiles at the mirror, and winks, and then, thankfully the video ends.

"Okay, did we have to watch that whole thing?" You ask, your face now beet-red. Not knowing where to look, you decide to stick your face into your wine cap again, and this time drain it dry.

"Oh. Sorry." Leaning aside casually and turning off the TV, Tien answers you lightly, before settling back and sipping from her own glass again. "You have to understand, it's been years since I've seen Sora just have fun like that. Not that I want to hire you to be her chew toy, I mean!" She rushes to clarify, seeing you start to frown.

"But you want to hire me because I can be?" You ask, feeling a little affronted. You start to feel a buzz coming on. Normally, your body's unusually chemically-resistant, for its size, and it still is. You've been sober for quite a long time lately, however...

"No, not at all." Tien objects. She moves to pick up the syringe again, dropping some more fluid into your empty cap. "I want to hire you because she's... how do I put this? She's a nervous wreck, and every thing we've done to try to socialize her has only made it worse. She has no self-confidence, so she's afraid to do or say anything around strangers, though-" she gestures towards the TV - "obviously, with you, it's-" Sora's voice interrupts her, all of a sudden. "Mom?"

The little girl is peeking around the corner into the room, looking imploringly at her. "Is everything okay? With Stevie? Is- is anyone in trouble?" She pleads, sounding regretful over something.

Tien chuckles. "Trouble? No, sweetie." She reassures her. "No one's in trouble. Mommy just wants Stevi- wants Steve to herself for a little while, okay?"

You take another drink as the woman soothes her nervous daughter, then stand up. The alcohol's in full swing, now. "Actually, someone is in trouble." You correct, pointing directly up at Sora from your sofa perch. "You, girlie! You're still in trouble for earlier. So, for your first task, let's see... I want you to be good, and wait patiently while I talk with your mom for a while, okay? Let's see... study, or practice your singing or something. Now, I wanna hear a 'yes, Lord Steven'!" You bark out the order imperiously, liquid fire burning through your veins and filling you with confidence. Sora stares at you in disbelief for a half-second, and then collapses into giggling.

"Yes, Lord Steven!"

She gives a mock salute, then disappears skipping down the hall, still laughing.

"So." As you turn back to Tien, you see her set her glass aside and start silently applauding you, bowing her head slightly in an exaggerated show of mock respect. Setting your own cup down, you fold your arms and talk to her directly: "If you're trying to pay me to be her punching bag, I- *hic* I'm not really interested, thanks."

"Noo, that's perfect! See? You can handle her!" Grinning broadly, she surprises you by suddenly laying back on the cushions, stretching herself across the couch with her hands behind her head, resting on the sofa arm opposite you. She writhes and wriggles around slightly as she goes on, shifting her six-foot frame to get more comfortable. You watch her lithe midsection twist and turn below you, the t-shirt hugging it just tight enough, and...

"I'll pay you 21k a year, six days a week, salaried." Tien keeps talking as she settles into the couch. "Also living expenses, paid vacations, sick days. Oh, and I'll sponsor your remedial courses for that last year of high school. And if you stick with it for six years straight, we'll fund your college tuition after." With one knee bent up, the other angled outwards, she rests both of her stockinged feet at the base of the couch arm right below you, then arches an eyebrow as if daring you to do something about it. "Thoughts?"

Distracted by the view, mentally on your back foot from her playful, confident expression, and booze coursing through your brain - the woman's an expert negotiator, apparently. You try thinking it over, and...
1222222221131222211211323133332133321223.title: Tiny Tutor Time?

1222222221131222211211323133332133321223.content:
Somewhere, in the back of your mind, alarm bells start going off as you open your mouth to answer. This is a really big commitment, your better nature calls out to you, a feeble voice that barely filters its way in through a cloud of booze and adrenaline. Don't rush it!

Steeling yourself against Tien's hopeful and expectant smile, you somehow force yourself to let her down. "That's- that sounds nice, but..." you hesitate. 21 grand a year? That's more than you've ever seen in your life! Was that actually good, though? You're vaguely aware that it seems somewhat on the low end... doesn't it? "I'll have to think about it for a while," you manage, gesturing to the overturned toothpaste cap cradled in your left arm. "I'm not, uh, exactly in the best state to be making that decision right now, haha..."

Tien smiles broadly. "Of course!" She accepts it easily, and smiles, to your relief. Then she winks at you and stretches a little more, catching you back off-guard again. It's been so long since you've properly socialized, (or drank, for that matter), every little jab this woman teases you with seems to fluster you uncontrollably, and you have little doubt she knows it.

Your suspicions are all but confirmed when she suddenly sits up, holding her open hand out just in front of you. "So why don't you come up here and tell me a bit about yourself, hmm?" She asks, lightly. "No need to be so distant; we've met before, you know!"

"Uh. Yeah, Sora told me..." you stammer, hesitating just a fraction of a second before killing the rest of your drink, and stepping onto the cheerful woman's waiting palm. It shoots suddenly forward towards her chest, carrying you with it. A moment later, she's laying back on the couch again, this time with you sitting cross-legged, heart racing and skin flushed, atop the soft, rhythmically-pulsing mound of her perky left breast.

As she shifts over slightly to reach out for the wine bottle again, catching you off-guard as you furiously avoided looking at her, you instinctively reach out and brace yourself against her protruding nipple, the thin white tank top doing little to blunt the feel of it through the cloth. Now magnified, much closer up, Tien's laughter booms behind you as you panic and pull away instantly, suddenly more acutely aware than ever that she's not wearing a bra.

"What, shy?" Her voice rings out overhead, once again sounding playful. "With how quickly you had Sora's lips all over you, I wouldn't have guessed!"

"It- it's not like that!" You can practically hear her smirk even before you spin around, looking up into her laughing face, steadying yourself against the shaking turf as she chuckles lightly - earthquake level tremors, from your perspective. "L-look, at my size, things are different, okay? I only get so much... choice... how I end up interacting with people..."

As you struggle to articulate the fundamental incongruities between normal and diminutive world views necessitated by your unique condition, while hardly at your most articulate in this intoxicated condition, Tien looks momentarily surprised and then contemplative, in turn, before slightly arching an eyebrow down at you. You suddenly realize that you're still bracing against her nipple with one hand, and jerk it back immediately and start apologizing.

She grins nonchalantly, and suddenly the syringe in her hand is filling up your wine bucket again. "Don't worry about it," she tries to laugh it off without actually laughing, now taking care to keep her breath steady so as not to shake you up too much. "I'm a happily married woman, but my wife and I may or may not still have a little Stevie doll in our toy collection, hmm?" She winks.

You sigh in relief, and then start in surprise. "Wait, wha-"

"Shh! That's a secret!" Tien lifts a finger to her lips, and cuts you off immediately. "So! Now that I told you one, maybe, now it's your turn. How's tiny life been for you since we met, other than sewers and my little girl, hmm? What's school like at that size? You have friends?" She leans in closer, conspiratorially, a naughty look in her eye. "Girlfriend?"

You think about it a moment, sitting nervously atop this woman's tit.

Oh, what the hell...

"If we're going to talk about that," you answer evenly, raising your now-full bucket up to your face. "I'm going to need just a bit of prep..."

...

Pain. It fills your world; your brain pounding against your skull like a cornered animal, your insides burning as they tear themselves apart. Your head reels uncontrollably as you start to regain consciousness, little by little, starting out with only just enough awareness to regret still being alive.

You're somewhere warm; hot, even. And cramped. Soft. Lying naked in a pool of thick, warm liquid that soaks you everywhere, coating every crevice of your body in slippery slime.

Without thinking, without even opening your eyes to look, you press your face into the yielding surface underneath you and open wide, slurping down a mouthful of the rich, thick, slightly-sweet and slightly-sour tasting fluid. It goes down heavily, but you don't care. Anything, any kind of hydration at all, to quell the agony burning within. It's not like you could possibly feel any sicker.

You swallow down another mouthful, and then another - groaning in pain, still with your eyes squeezed shut against whatever sights of hell you're sure to find. You don't even care what's going on right now. You just want to stop hurting so much; or, failing that, at least die quickly...

You slurp the area around you dry, and then, unwilling to move in search of more, stick out your tongue and lap at the floor below you. This turns out to be a mistake.

A familiar texture greets you as you lick and suck at the rough, damp, squishy surface pressing against you, and then suddenly everything starts shaking. Familiar, feminine laughter booms all around you, sending your headache into what's surely near-lethal territory as you recognize the sound, suddenly waking up all at once and realizing where you are.

Like a bad dream, amplifying your suffering, memories of last night start to filter in. Just brief, vague ones: Tien teasing you about the girls in your life, or lack thereof. Hotly defending your honor. More drinks. Getting her phone. Contacting your parents. Contacting her wife. Posing for nudes which she goaded you into sending her wife yourself, getting you to work the 'send' button after taking them.

You've made a fool of yourself, all right. That much you know for sure.

What you don't know, is how you ended up here...
1222222221131222211211323133332133321223.title: Losing to Attrition

choices: Refuse. You're in no condition for labor.
Agree. Whatever gets you out of this the fastest... but, can you handle it?
Before you can answer, you throw up - time to get swallowed! =(
1222222221131222211211323133332133321223.content:
The booming, skull-splitting laughter washes over you as the surface tilts, and you're suddenly rolled aside, your limp body pushed between smooth molars and into the painfully familiar cavity of Sora's cheek. You're suffering far too much to even want to fight back, just letting the wet tongue carry you where it pleases. "AWW, GOOD 'OWNING, 'ET! 'ID 'Y WIDDLE 'ET JUSS' GI' ME A KITHH?" She mocks you.

You're sure it would be far too early in the morning for these kinds of games, even if you weren't going through a life-altering experience of a hangover at the moment, but you don't even have energy to be annoyed at this. Right now, you just want to retch. That, and see if you can replace the subsequently-lost contents of your stomach with enough water to douse the napalm fires spreading throughout your insides, despite the several mouths' full of fluid you've just gulped down.

Realizing what it was, that you just chugged, doesn't make you want to throw it up any less - to put it lightly. "Sora..." you manage out a whimper. "Stop shouting..."

You can barely even hear yourself, just over the sound of her heartbeat and breath flowing over you, but surprisingly, she seems to notice. Unfortunately, that means her tongue shoves you deeper behind her back molar so she can talk a little better. "WASS' 'AT, STEVIE?" She asks, innocently, holding her breath to wait.

You take a deep breath, and feebly work up the nerve to shout back briefly, knowing full well how it's going to hurt. "I said WHAT AM I DOING HERE? LET ME OUT!" You yell, to be rewarded with another crushing blow from your throbbing headache. "Arhh!" You cringe, half-curling up as you grasp your temples. You do NOT want to have to sit here and talk about this much longer.

Unfortunately for you, Sora has other plans. "'OPE!" She giggles some more, and uses the back of her tongue to cram you even further out of the way of her animate jawline. "YOU DON' R'MEMBER? YOU CLIMBED IN 'DERE ON YER OWN! MOMMIE SAID YOU SHOUL' GO 'OO BED, SO I OPEN' MA MOUTH, AN' YOU 'OPPED RIGHT IN! *TEE HEE!*" Another barely-restrained fit of laughter, the kind that says 'I am never letting you live this one down...'

If your stomach could sink any further at this point, it would be doing so. You're sure of it. "I did not!" You shout back hotly, momentarily forgetting about the pain. "Seriously, let me out already! I'm gonna be sick, ohhhh go-..." You stop short, fighting back a gag...

"'ID TOO!" You get back in answer. "MOMMIE BROUGHT YOU IN ALL WET, WEARIN' A NAPKIN', AN' SAID YOU 'AD A BI' TOO MUCH DRINK BU' SHE CLEANED 'OO UP ALWEADY AN' 'OO SHOUL' GO T' BED. SO I OPEN' 'Y MOUF', AN' YOU DROP' TH' NAPKIN AN' JUS' HOPPED WIGHT IN!"

"Ohhh, fuu-" You'd thought last night couldn't have gotten any worse than the flashbacks from earlier, but this morning is on a fast track to being the worst one on record, for anyone, possibly ever. It gets even worse when there's sudden, rising movement, as Sora starts to sit up and look around. "Sorrra, I'm gonna hurrrrll- oop!" You shout at the parted lips up ahead of you, before biting back against a sudden heave.

Luckily, that seems to give her some pause. And then, she talks again. "IF 'OO FROW' UP IN DERE, I'M G'NA SWALLOW YOU!" She says, suddenly threatening. Then gets up and starts walking nonchalantly across her room, giving you brief glimpses of it out of her jaws as she speaks.

"AN' IF YOU'RE FEELIN' SICK, 'OO SHOUL' STAY IN BED!" This one is a lot more teasing, and comes with a brief chuckle as she closes her lips, then parts her teeth widely and dumps you back atop her waiting tongue. At least she refrains from actively playing with you, for once, as you try to adjust from being shaken around as she talked, to bouncing roughly every time she takes a step.

Saliva pools around you again, splashing into your face. But now that you're fully awake and aware of what it is, you resist the urge to drink it at least. Wiping the thick layer of ooze from your face, despite knowing the futility of it, you manage to shout ahead: "At least get me some water, I'm dying of thirst in here! I'-hk!" A slight twitch of her tongue - which you half-suspect was intentional on her part - dunks your head in spit again, cutting you off. A horrible realization comes to you, as you spit and swipe, and clear it out again.

"Oh, god... you didn't brush your teeth this morning, did you!?" The nausea in you is reaching critical mass. It's amazing you haven't spewed all everything already.

Though she doesn't laugh, you can just make out the corner of her mouth twitch into a smirk, before she answers:

"'OPE! BU' I' OO' DO I' FO' ME, I MI' 'JUS' 'ET 'OO OUT!" With you splayed out on top of her tongue, her speech is even less coherent than before, and bounces you up and down even more. Through your nausea and disorientation, you make out glances of a smiling, pajama-clad Sora stood in front of a bathroom mirror, holding up a paste-covered toothbrush, before she plunges it into her mouth.

The head of the brush slides roughly past you, jostling you and somewhat intruding 'your' space, as you look incredulously at it and work up an answer:
1222222221131222211211323133332133321223.title: Bed? Breakfast?

choices: Let you out, once she get dressed. (Tien's embarrassed.)
1222222221131222211211323133332133321223.content:
You stare incredulously at the brush head that Sora thrust at you, and turn back to shout between her slightly parted lips. "Sora, I'm not brushing your teeth for you! Just- agh! Just let me rest!" You wince as your head pounds again, and let your head fall with a plop! back to the slimy surface of the tongue. You know what? At this point, you don't even care. If you have to just lie down and be miserable for another couple of hours, this was as good a place as any.

Well, it would be if she'd calm down, at least. Which she probably would, given that you're not playing along.

...or if you had some clothes. You remember stripping your shorts off in Tien's hand and swinging them excitedly over your head, last night, but fuck if you remember where they'd gone.

But, this being a borderline medical-emergency level hangover, you can't even be bothered to care about that right now.

"...'kay."

You catch a quick glimpse, in the mirror outside, of pajama shoulders shrugging softly, and then you're gently rolled aside and deposited back into a bulging cheek. You hear the brush start scratching over the other side of your fleshy encampment, and an eye-wateringly strong scent of menthol wafts over you as the toothpaste is spread around.

It's strong enough to make it hard to breathe, but, fuck, is there a bright side to it: Your stomach starts to settle down, a little at a time, as you take in the minty smell. You've heard of mint drops being used to soothe nausea before, but, damn. If this was how much better you could feel just from inhaling it, you'd almost be tempted to drink down more spit just to get that minty freshness down your throat. If you didn't know that the toothpaste, as a whole, would just make you sicker...

By the time Sora finishes brushing the other side of her teeth, and her tongue, you almost feel well enough not to suffer when you're promptly pulled back onto her tongue, shifted, and then expertly deposited into the other cheek so she can finish brushing the side you started in. You start to breathe a little easier, becoming used to the menthol-heavy fumes.

Finally, when the brush retreats, the floor tilts back, and a flood of water comes pouring in from up ahead, you're actually pretty well ready for it. You manage to resist the urge to hurl as the wave crashes down on you, pulls you into the center of her mouth, and swishes you around thoroughly before the jaws close and the tongue presses up to expel the tide, the current flooding past you to spill out through the rows of teeth that catch you and trap you inside.

Another wave comes in, repeating the process, and you handle it well enough. Your head is spinning faster than ever, but at least your gut stays mostly steady. Again, the flow of slightly sweet, minty, somewhat-slimy water is expelled, leaving you behind, and you settle down almost comfortably on Sora's tongue, waiting for the spinning to stop so you can regain your bearings.

Another flood of water comes in, but this time, she doesn't swirl it around. Just opens her jaws slightly, lips sealed, letting some air in from the back of her throat, and leaving you floating in the pool of water trapped in her mouth. "Huh?" You wonder, waiting for the action to start as you float up, crouched on hands and knees in the extra space afforded.

Then, the world's loudest *ahem* makes you flinch in pain, as your head hasn't been getting the same therapeutic vibes as your stomach has from all this treatment. The tip of Sora's tongue curls up, prodding at you pointedly, and settles back again. You feel some movement - walking, turning, sitting, - but her mouth holds perfectly still. Relatively speaking, that is.

Oh... she gave me some water, you realize, with a grimace. All the water you could drink, not that you'd exactly want to.

But... hell with it. She'd just rinsed her mouth out twice; this is about as clean as it's going to get. The longer you wait and the more it gets stirred up, the more you're going to regret it. You dip your head down, and start to chug. And chug. And chug. By the time you start noticing the slight taste of toothpaste and spit in the solution, your stomach's practically fit to burst, and you're all too happy to stop there.

You hear the sound of running water, in the background. Then, what's clearly a toilet flushing. You'd be embarrassed to have been present for the part that came prior, but, ah. At least this time, you weren't actively participating. On the receiving end.

There's a rustle of cloth, as Sora presumably starts getting changed. Then, you feel yourself start to suddenly move as she takes a step, and-

Splash!

Splash?

Splash!

Was she...?

You have your answer as there's a sudden drop - Sora sitting down - then yet another as she lies back, pressing you to the roof of her mouth with her tongue as it closes in on you, swallowing down the remaining mix of spit and water. All along, you hear more splashing from outside, as she lays down in the tub. She hadn't been getting dressed at all - she'd been getting ready to take a bath!

There's minor movement as the outside world, - that is, Sora, - starts to soap herself, hitting you with yet another sudden wave of head pain as she starts to quietly hum to herself. Quietly for her, that is. You open your mouth to yell when she suddenly starts to play with you - the tip of her tongue, by either sheer luck or supernatural intuition, choosing just this time to curl up and poke its way into your open mouth, cutting off your attempt at speech. When you pull away, it rolls over you, pushing your head down and pulling back to slide your aching, still feebly-struggling body under her tongue.

You lie on your back, head resting against the base of her incisors, trying in vain to fend off the giant muscle as it drapes itself atop of you, the soft, slippery surface easily draping itself over you and once again absorbing any attempts you made at speech. It plays with you almost idly, just gently sliding back and forth over your captive frame, pushing you around in the puddles of spit gathering inside her gums. If Sora hadn't been humming to herself all this time, perhaps she would have noticed the minute vibrations buzzing against her flesh, every time you got your head clear enough to try to shout, but...

The humming, motion, and splashing all come to a swift and sudden halt, with the unmistakable sound of a knock at the bathroom door.

"Hmm!?" Sora bolts suddenly upright, as her mother's voice faintly filters in through your sopping, fleshy surroundings...

"Sorry to...upt...know where Stevie is right n-?"

A quick nod of Sora's head shakes you up, doing unpleasant things to your own, still-pounding head.

"-t, you m...still i-...mouth!?"

Another quick nod. "M-hm!"

You cringe, and try to shout out: "Not by choice, Ms- Doctor- Tien, I'm really, really sorry!" You can't see what's going on out there, or hear what she's saying if she's started talking again, but you start sweating profusely as you try to imagine how she's handling the news that you're with her underage daughter in the bath - however involuntarily.

And so, momentarily unable to see, hear, or even smell, feel, or taste anything outside of Sora's mouth, your only hint at her mother's reaction is when her tongue slides off of you all of a sudden, then twists back around to scoop you up and...
1222222221131222211211323133332133321223.title: Brush Pass

choices: "...I'll let you out in just a little bit.~"
"...it's just you 'n me 'till mom gets back from work, so let's make it fun!"
"...mommy says now, I get to keep you!"
1222222221131222211211323133332133321223.content:
After an intense moment of waiting in relative silence, with only a dull murmur of conversation reaching you from outside, you find yourself suddenly scooped up onto Sora's tongue again. Ready to finally be released, and face her mom somehow, you shield your eyes in preparation, not wanting to risk getting a glance at Sora in the bath, or to be seen doing so...

...when the tongue shifts, and throws you into the back of her throat instead.

Opening your eyes wide, you start to scream as you realize what's happening. "Noooo-mmph!"

*gulp*

Sora's grown much more confident in her devouring of you lately. Your attempts to resist don't even register, as the powerful muscles grip firmly around your head and chest, pulling you down into her throat.

*gulp*

...and just like that, it's down the hatch for you again. You're beyond furious, but there's nothing you can do against the python-like grip of the fleshy tube as it works with gravity to squeeze you along, ultimately ejecting you face-first into the wrinkled pit of Sora's stomach cavity.

To make matters worse, the little(*) girl's voice booming around you is not apologetic, nor distraught, nor anything that would suggest this was some kind of accident to be addressed. In fact, she's giggling about it. You know she's a child, but how could she be so inconsiderate? And right in front of her own mother, to boot!

At least the stomach is relatively empty of contents, apart from yourself and a small pool of slimy acid water. Which is better than the alternative, you suppose.

At which point you hit the disturbing realization that you've been swallowed by people so many times at this point, you're now starting to critique the conditions of their stomachs like it's the weather or something. "Ah, yes, little humid today, could be worse..." You want to chastise yourself for it, but aren't entirely sure how.

More importantly, at least right now, you also naturally realize that her stomach was empty, right now, because she still hadn't eaten breakfast yet. You brood, darkly, and tell yourself that if she tells you to sit in her stomach and eat the food she swallows down again, you're going to have words with Tien. Well, you're going to have words with Tien anyway, but these words will begin with telling her how she can shove her offer and you never want to see either of them ever again.

A slight but sudden shift throws you down to the squishy floor of the slimy sac of your enclosure, accompanied by dampened splashing noises just outside, beyond the pulsing walls. Then, Sora's voice speaks up again:

"You hear that, Stevie? ..."
1222222221131222211211323133332133321223.title: Another Letdown

choices: ...you'll sleep in my room, from now on.
...I'll have a nice terrarium made up for you, instead.
...from now on, we'll have her swallow you before she goes to bed.
1222222221131222211211323133332133321223.content:
"Mommy says now, I get to keep you!"

What?

Did Sora's mother seriously tell her she could just swallow you without permission just now?

Or was she referring to something else?

Did you end up drunkenly signing Tien's contract last night, at some point? If so, given your severe inebriation, there's no way that it was legally binding. And it certainly didn't give Sora the right to do whatever she wants with you, in any case.

You try to make known your displeasure by kicking roughly at the stomach wall before you, but Sora doesn't seem to notice it. All that happens is that her stomach responds by contracting roughly a couple of times, sending you sprawling down into a pool of stinking bile. So you have no choice but to just wait for it to settle down and then, grumbling, sit yourself back up as comfortably as you can, which means curling up with your arms wrapped around your knees in the narrow space afforded...

Finally, after much rocking, swaying, and bouncing roughly around as Sora finishes bathing, dresses, and skips throughout the house, you sense the familiar rhythmic, violent contractions of her trying to hack you back up her throat. Glad to not have to sit through breakfast inside her gut again, at least, you readily go along with it, and find yourself shooting back up the girl's esophagus and landing with a splat on her waiting tongue again in short order.

Then light floods the fleshy cavern, and Sora's tongue slips out of her mouth and downwards, depositing you on a waiting palm. She seems to give you a moment to catch your bearings, and you do so, wiping your eyes free of sticky spit and turning yourself around to face her.

"Listen, Sora." You say severely, with as much dignity as you can muster, as soon as your eyes are able to focus and take her in. Her eyes widen almost imperceptibly, as if she's seemingly surprised and somewhat taken aback by your tone. "I need to talk to your mom, okay? Right now."

"Yes, sweetie." Tien's voice booms directly behind you, taking you by surprise. You swivel around to see she's standing in the kitchen, right in front of her confused-looking daughter.

"Why don't you let Stevie and me have a little chat, and I'll call you back when we're done, okay?"

"Uh... okay." Sora recoils nervously a little, looking back and forth between you and Tien with some concern, then holds her palm with you on it out in her direction. Tien extends her own in turn, letting you, face flushed and cringing slightly, covering your nakedness as best you could with just your hands, step forward onto it.

Quickly, Sora flees the kitchen, and you sigh heavily as you turn to face her mother whose palm you're standing on. "Tien, listen. About that offer you made last night, I really don't think that-"

"Let me stop you right there." Bluntly, she interrupts you. Her fingers suddenly curl around your body roughly, squeezing you tightly enough to take you completely by surprise and cut you off, stopping just short of actually hurting you. The look that she gives you is cold, frosty, nothing like the teasing flirt you remember from yesterday. She raises you up to her face, looking dead into your eyes.

"Last night, I not only watched you strip off your clothes and flop your nude body, crotch and all, into my underage daughter's mouth - I also recorded it." Hearing these words, your blood runs cold.

"L-listen, Tien," you stammer, filled with sudden fear. "It's not-"

"If I turn that footage in to the police, you'll be looking at so much prison time, that little girl with be a gray, old crone when you get out," she interrupts you. "That's if a pocket-sized child molester can even last that long in prison."

You gape, and shiver with fear as it comes crashing down on you just how much deep shit you're in. You really haven't done anything wrong, at least not intentionally, but this could still ruin your entire life. Right now, you realize your entire future is at the stern-looking woman's mercy.

"But, I'm not going to do that."

"You're..." you almost can't believe it. "You're not?"

"No." She says firmly - without letting up her grip. "Because I'm going to assume you didn't do anything... untoward, with her. And because playing with you makes her feel powerful and appreciated, which is something she really needs more of in her life after what she's been through." She gives you a brittle smile. "So when I call her back in here, I'm going to set you down on this table, and you're going to tell her yourself that you've decided you want to stay with us, and be her faithful little pet."

The last part hits you like so proverbial other-shoes finally dropping: "Her- her what!?"

"You heard me." The smile doesn't leave her face. "Yesterday, I was willing to settle for a little mentor-slash-companion for her; now, you don't really have a choice. It's either her, or some tattooed ex-biker, recovering meth addict named Butch who trades you out to other inmates for packs of cigarettes."

You feel sick to your stomach. "Wh- why?" You ask, not believing the flirty hot mom from yesterday could turn out like this.

Tien does look somewhat remorseful. "Because I love my daughter," she sighs, reaching up with a finger to stroke the back of your head as she talks. "And I worry about her health, and I think she would really benefit from having one relationship in her life where she feels like she's the one in control." She gives a bit of a pained smile, now. "And you don't really have a choice."

You look down, feeling defeated. Noting your expression, Tien finally loosens her grip, and sets you down on the kitchen table. "And just so we're clear," she adds, seriously, "if I find out you're taking sexual advantage of her, I'll cut your balls off with a scalpel. Understood?"

This part really gets to you, and you look up at her in sudden anger. "Lady, I don't know if you've noticed, but I'm kind of small? I don't really get a lot of say in most of what people do with me, you of all people oughtta be aware of that." You spit, letting the venom seep freely into your voice at that last part.

"Fair enough." To your surprise, she sounds somewhat conciliatory. Then a hand reaches up, and the tip of an upturned fingernail pushes your chin up, forcing you to look up at her. "But if she starts... getting curious, you tell me right away so I can put a stop to it, okay?"

"You just told me you'll send me to prison if I don't agree to be her pet, now you're saying you'll stick up for me with her?" You ask, flabbergasted.

"Yeah," Tien chuckles. "Pretty much. But, look: she was already calling you her pet before I got here; I just want to make it official so she feels more confident about it. Otherwise, just keep doing what you've already been doing with her - provided it's all strictly platonic, of course."

"It- it is! Was! Has been!" You insist.

"Good. I'm going to choose to believe that, because I want to give you the benefit of the doubt. And because I assume you were too drunk to manage an erection in my daughter's mouth last night." She gives you a meaningful look.

"I was," you answer, quickly. "Also when I woke up. Wasn't a good time."

"Okay. Then we're all clear. Sora!" She suddenly shouts, signaling the end of the conversation and leaving you filled with mounting apprehension as you realize what comes next. Soon, rapid pattering footsteps build in volume as they approach, shortly thereafter accompanied by the young girl's frame entering the kitchen.

"Mhm?"

Tien smiles as Sora eagerly approaches, bouncing up and down on the balls of her feet in front of the table, glancing down at you. "Sweetie," her mother says gently, showing none of the threatening nature she'd just displayed to you alone, "Stevie here has something he wanted to tell you. Isn't that right, Stevie?" She nods at you, smiling.

"Teehee~" Sora leans in towards you all at once, startling you into jumping back as her face zooms in to within inches of your own on the table. Stumbling to right yourself while still covering up front with your hands, you search for words as her breath blows over you, disregarding your sense of space. "Umm..."

"What is it, Stevie!?" As Sora smiles, you can't help but notice, out of the corner of your eye, as her arms come down to rest on the table around you, hands clasped together behind your back.

You stammer: "S-so, your mom and I were talking, and-" not knowing what else to do, you simply force yourself to say the words outright: "I've decided to be your pet."

"Oh, I know!" Sora answers cheerfully, unfazed. "Mommy said that earlier. Thanks, Stevie!" Without warning, her hands close in from behind you and snatch you up in their grasp, bringing you to her lips for a kiss. "Mwa! You're the best pet ever!" She squeals, hugging you to her chest. Just like yesterday, come to think of it.

As you try to resolve the conflicting emotions of humiliating yourself before a child, being grabbed and handled without consent, and being showered with affection from the admittedly adorable kid, she giggles a little bit as she hugs you close. "Ew, you do need a bath though!"

Tien's voice comes in again as she starts to leave, smiling happily at your little interaction. "Just don't do anything inappropriate with him, okay sweetie? Not until you're older."

"Okay..."

Wait, what? Older? How long was she going to make you keep playing along with this?

"Does that mean we should get him new clothes?" Sora asks.

"Only if you want to, sweetie. He's your pet," says Tien. "But make sure you put him to bed before going to sleep, okay?"

You call out as Tien walks off: "Wait, what? To bed?"

She stops in the doorway and turns, smiling. "Yes. Can't have you sleeping in Sora's mouth anymore, so..."
1222222221131222211211323133332133321223.title: Lasting Consequences

choices: Should I get us pizza for tonight?
1222222221131222212.content:
Sora blushed and grinned. "Oookay~" she spoke as she set you on her body. God the Snell was divine, some orange citrusy scent. Though looking up you could not help but utter a small "Wow..."

Right in front of you were her ribs, and behind you the waistband of the bathing skirt... You blushed and tried not to think about what lay beneath it. Or how easy you could just slide right in.

"Cat got your tongue Stevie?" Sora grinned as she spoke.

"Wu-wuh?" You replied as she repeated herself, "I said you gonna stare all day or get a move on?"

"Oh umm... Right." You gulped, beginning your trek. All the while taking in the sights. God, were you a few years younger she'd be perfect for you. But... Age was a thing. Still hers was the first female body you'd seen in a while. Hell, while was putting it mildly...

You were broken out of your thoughts as you felt fabric underneath you and heard an eep. "Sora what's..." You gulped, noticing your hand on the bikini fabric. Above her...

"Sorry! I was lost in thought! I wasn't watching where I was going a-and..." You were cut off by Sora pushing you against her flesh.

"Ju-just surprised me is all..." Unknown to her you could hear her heartbeat beneath you. It was... Very rapid. "It's okay."

"Sora it's not okay! I'm a full gro--" you stared up at her as she tried to suppress her giggles. "Okay a tiny grown man. Still! I'm really sorry.".

"I said it's fine dude."

"B-but..." You stammered out.

"Steven." She spoke up with sternness in her voice. Before looking down. "It's fine... You..." She blushed, "You can cl-climb my bre-- climb breast mountain."

You gulped as you proceeded onwards. Trying to disregard her stifled moans as you climbed. Until you finally made it to the top, standing upon one of her dangling lengths of hair. "So Sora... Your heart beats pretty fast... You really okay?"

Sora blushed as she brought her hair around you. "Wait Sora what are you..." You gulped and gasped as she brought you up to her plush lips, you knew it! The little sneak was gonna eat you!

"Nahm" she vocalized as she 'bit' you with her lips. Giggling and blushing as she looked at you. She was just playing.

"Thought you were gonna eat me again." You breathed a sigh of relief.

"Thought about it... " She looked like she had something on her mind.

"Sora?"

"So... I didn't want to say it but... I know who you are m-mcminor. Sort of." She blushed

"Well yeah I told you who I was..." Your heart skipped, "Except my last name... How do you know that?"

Sora set you on her knee as she pulled them forward. Dunking her head a bit. "My mom. She's a doctor. She's did her fancy college thing on you. I was pretty young but she brought me along to see you cause she couldn't get a babysitter..."

You recalled that, being poked and prodded at 12 for a bunch of PHD students. "You were there?"

Sora nodded. "I thought it was so cool that you were small. But... We moved after that. So I never saw you again..."

You looked her over, "You uhh... Grew up." You blushed a bit, grinning sheepishly. So she'd seen you way back when? Shit.

"Small world right?" She smirked.

"I see what you did there young lady." You chuckled as did she. It was nice, others were always so careful around you. But she... She treated you more like a person. More like... You.

"I take it you want me to meet your mom.. err... Moms." You watched as she nodded.

"Just... She'd probably kill me if she knew you were here and I let you get away."

You chuckled a bit nervously. "So I never got to asking... You adopted then?"

She shook her head, "Nope. My momma divorced my dad then got married again. They met at the hospital they work at. You'd like them both... Especially my other mom. She's short like you!"

Like you... Like... Wait... "She's small? Like... My size?"

Sora giggled, "No sorry... My mom is six foot and she's like... Four foot ten." She chuckled. "So she's short."

You sighed and chuckled as you sat back. "So why the secrecy then?"

A loud knock on Sandra’s door prevents you from being crushed by the sultry vixens foot. The pressure stops and Sandra lifts her foot up a few inches for you to breath. You cough and gasp for air as you rub your mouth with the back of your hand trying to get the taste of feet out of your mouth. Her foot still hovers above your head, looming over you as you lie flat on the ground.
“Who is it?” Sandra called out, giving you a glance downwards to make sure you’re still pinned under her foot.
“It’s me honey, is your friend going to stay for lunch?” Sandra sighs as her mother walks into the room. She thought that her mom was still at work and wouldn’t get home later, but apparently she was wrong. Sandra lowered her foot a little, making sure her sole was pinning you flat to the ground. It would be a disaster if her mother saw you, so Sandra compressed you under her foot and out of her mother’s sight.
“I guess Angela’s staying.” The plan was that they were going to torment their new little pet all morning and into the afternoon, but now it was going to be risky with her mom in the house. They could still force you to worship them, but now they would have to keep it down.
“Are you standing on something?” The question halted Sandra’s train of thought. She looked quickly over at Angela, who was equally worried about being caught.
“No,” Sandra quickly said and then placed her right foot completely on top of you, putting as much weight as she dared down on you. You let out a squeak as you were pushed deep into the fabric of the carpet, which was the only thing protecting you from becoming a stain. Being totally beneath Sandra’s huge foot caused you to start panicking. Was she trying to crush you to hid the evidence from her mom or was she just trying to keep you from being noticed? It was hard to think with the sick, warm flesh of the foot mashing against your naked body. Your bones creak as the pressure continues, even if you survive this, you’re going to be in a lot of pain later on. Your face is pressed against the meaty flesh, drowning you in the putrid smell of her unwashed foot.
Sandra’s mother looks several times at her daughter’s feet trying to tell if she’s really hiding something. While she does this, you slowly are suffocating under Sandra’s foot.

Your eyes widened in recognition as you caught a whiff of a familiar odor and saw the clothes neatly aligned in an almost unnatural fashion; you were in a sock drawer. Sitting down you start pondering what could've happened to get you into this situation, your hangover was quite the annoyance when you tried this.

Despite your mind reeling in pain you attempt to piece together what happened. You recalled all the events up until you started swimming in tequila but not much else after that. Tapping your foot against the wooden floor you sat on you tried to place the owner of that female voice you heard mere moments ago.

"Angela?" You mutter aloud your dear friends name as a possibility,she was there after all; then again things got pretty wild and you were fairly certain that some other girls who you had never met before were there too. Struggling with your hazy memory you try to recall what girls aside from Angela were there.

Through the hazy memory you formed a decent mental picture of the group before you got wasted, Angela and some of her friends, all guys so that ruled them out. You faintly remember this quite girl dressed in black, someone you probably saw before but didn't remember, her persona was probably that of a goth or at least someone depressed. There was one other stranger you remember, you never caught her name but she was a redhead with a very loud mouth never giving anyone a chance to speak; she seemed more of a thug or perhaps a troublemaker.

There was also the possibility that it was none of these girls, with your practically worthless memory there was no telling. You would've slapped yourself if you weren't slightly wary that your head my burst open, thats how much it hurt. Interrupting your reasoning was the female you had been trying to name, light filled the drawer and as your eyes adjusted you were looking at....

1251.content:
As Steve figured out that he was in a jar, he also figured out that the jar is in a suitcase. Immediately he banged on the jar and shouted "Let me out! Let me out!"

Eventually the suitcase was zipped open, sending a blinding light into Steve's jar. By the time, he opened his eyes, he saw himself being placed into a purse by a woman's hand.

"Let me go!" he shouted.

The woman was blonde, brown-eyed. She was from ________ who replied in _______.

12511.content:
The woman looked to be from Austrila,because you recongize that accent at once. How in the world did you get here? And where was Angela, you best friend? WHAT THE HELL HAPPENED LAST NIGHT??


"Hey, you keep quiet" said the woman rather sharply. "I dunno if you remember, but your Angela sold you to me last night after the party....I doubt if she remembers selling you at all now"

Your head is still killing you, and you wish it would just go away so you could think. You don't remember meeting this woman after the party...hell, you can't remember much of the party now. Why did this woman bought you in the first place? Is she gonna eat you...or will she do something else?


"My name is Mary" said the woman. "and we're on our way to Austrlia. Nearly there, too"

You look around and notice that you're in an airplane. The jar that you're in has holes in the lid for you to breathe...and there's also a piece of lettuce for you to eat. The piece of lettuce is bigger than you. You look up at Mary. She's not a bad-looking woman at all. She has blonde hair and brown eyes and at least a D-Cup. You grab your head and moan.

"Get some sleep" said Mary. "that's the best cure for a hangover"

She was so shitfaced it took no more than a hundred bucks and a few minutes of smooth talking for me to get my hands on you." Something mixed with the darkness and the hangover you still battled caused you to drift off to sleep, falling oblivious to the world around you which had just changed so drastically. Your dream started off like normal, nothing out of the blue as you went along your normal day. That was before the ground beneath you fell out, and you soon followed, freefalling into nothingness, before you looked down to see the giant face of Mary, smiling as she opened her mouth to await your landing.

The case was opened, and the familiar face from your nightmare was still there, and she grabbed to jar before raising it to her face.

"Hope your feeling better now little guy, cause we've got some business." She proclaimed in that same accent, before
1251122.title: Not Going Anywhere

1251123.content:
“Excuse me?” You say in disbelief.

“You heard me little guy” Mary says as a matter of factly. “I bought you for $100 from some drunken sucker but you’re worth way more than that and I’m going to take advantage of this opportunityt.”

“You can’t just sell me!” You shout in protest.

“Of course, I can.” Mary said in a smug tone “I’m bigger than you and I can do whatever I want with you, and I chose to make a profit.”

“Who are you going to give me to?” You ask still angry.

“I have plenty of girl friends with plenty of money who would probably love to have a tiny man.” Mary says as she shakes your jar with an evil smile. “I guess the good news is that they’re not mean so I imagine you’ll just be treated like a pet and be humiliated at worst.”

“But I have my own life! You can’t just sell me to some stranger!” You say indignantly.

“I guess you did have your own life.” Mary retorted. “Now your life will be to belong to the highest bidder. But enough talk, we’re going to land soon so you’re going back in my purse.”

With that, she lowers the jar into her purse and zips you in. There’s absolutely no hope of escaping and all you can do is wait.

What happens next?

choices: Her purse (you included) are suddenly stolen!
12512.content:
"Let me go! Let me out!!" you cry as the purse closes and you are plunged into darkness. This doesn't stop you from screaming at the top of your lungs however, and the walls of the jar only seem to amplify the sound of your voice.

Finally, after a few moments the purse opens and your jar is pulled out. You now find yourself staring directly into the very annoyed looking, if beautiful face, of your captor. She stares you right in the eye before she opens her mouth and spouts absolute gibberish at you.

Alright, obviously a foreigner; but you quickly decide that you can handle this with grace and dignity.

"What?!" you scream.

The blond haired woman blows air past her lips in an exasperated fashion and you're momentarily glad to be in the jar as it protected you from being blown off her hand.

"Look," she says in English this time though with a thick accent, "girl at your party sold you to me. Now, we return to Mother Russia where scientist will discover secret to your... condition."

You manage to catch a glimpse over her shoulder and realize with building dread that she's at an airport. That's why you were taken from the suitcase. She wants to keep you as 'carry-on.' This is not good.

You realize, with some relief, that she won't just be able to carry you on-board the plain in the jar. Either she'll put you in a pocket and you'll cry out to the first guard that comes close enough, or you'll get x-rayed and security will have a few questions about the jar in her purse that seems to have a tiny living man in it. After all, where else could she put you? With a shudder, you decide that you don't really want to find out.

Besides, you rather get out of this mess before it reaches that point.

"Okay," you start, speaking politely yet somewhat slowly so that she can keep up, "listen to me miss..."

"Irina," she replies, her tone flat. She sounds bored to death with this conversation already.

"Irina," you repeat before continuing on, "I have a family here that will be looking for me and you certainly won't be able to smuggle me past airport security; so why don't you just let me go right now and we'll forget this whole unfortunate event happened. What do you say?"

You are momentarily excited to see that she smiles at your question but your hope begins to sink soon after as the smile grows into a laugh as she shakes her head.

"No, no," she says as you strain to understand what she's saying, "I have been paid a lot of money to retrieve you and we are goings home. Now... where to hide you?"

Before she can decide, someone bumps into her, stealing her bag. She's momentarily stunned, but the bag the thief left looks the same, which should give you a few minutes to get away.

To you relief, your captor leaves the airport, getting into the back of a car that immediately speeds off. A hand gently takes you from the bag. It belongs to a middle-aged black woman with a kind smile. She's dressed professionally in a dark suit with a blue tie.

"Hello, Steve. My name is Jenna. I work for ___. I'd like you to come with me and answer some questions."

1252.content:
You cant quite see where you are very well, seeing as though you just woke up a little while ago. Your vision is very fuzzy.. all you see is dark. Light dark sorta. As you feel around, you start to realize the walls around you are so soft and squishy. You have to admit: It feels kinda good against your skin. You wouldnt mind falling back asleep right here, but you still have to figure out where you are in the first place!

You look up and see quite a huge bright light from the ceiling of.. where you are. Out of curiosity, you decide to climb up to it. Maybe it'll give a clue of where you are.

The moment you reach the top, the first thing that greets your recovered view is a gigantic head smiling down at you! This head is of a girl, probably about your age. A dark skin-toned girl with big beautiful hazel eyes, luscious light-dark lips, long black hair that you assume might be wrapped in a ponytail. You dont recognize her... but you cant take your eyes off her! You stare at her for quite an awful while... before realizing your predicament!

According to what you see, you seem to have just come out of the girl's shirt.... so those soft dark walls you saw and felt... you were between the girl's breasts!!!! Oh what a hell of place to wake up to!

Luckily, she just smiled down at you and spoke in a thick Hispanic accent, "¡Buenos diaz, el gringo pequeño!"
Hmm... you turn your head away from the woman to check where she's taken you! This place isnt familiar to you... mostly desert... chickens running around... a few dark skinned cholos with tattoos talking to eachother in spanish... a peddler going around selling corn... and a huge Pepsi bilboard with the slogan '¡Y YA!' Oh.... crap!

Mexico?! Youre in Mexico??!! How the hell'd you wind up here?! Boy, you must have been M.C. Hammered when Angela and Brad drugged you! God... and who is this humongous Hispanic girl you woke up too?!

"¿Pozo del sueño, papi?" she asks you with a grin on her face as if you've... done some pretty wicked stuff to her hours ago!! Sigh... still, you might need her to tell you how you got here in the first place! However... it's not gonna be that easy what with a language barrier!

"Um...EXCUSE ME!!" you shout up to her, "DO YOU... SPEAK....ENGLISH?"

"¿Hmm?" she just tilts her head and looks at you questionably. You can take that as a 'no'. It looks like youre gonna have to be the bilingual one here..

And it just so happens...

12521.content:
"Perdon, señorita. Necesito ayuda. ¿Hablas inglés?" Your pronunciation isn't phenominal, but you didn't get a C+ on your speaking final for nothing.

"No, señor." She shakes her head slightly. "¿Quieres algo de beber? Tú pareces sediento"

"Sí, por favor," you reply, though you're only about 80% sure you understood her. She puts you back between her breasts (they have to be at least C cups) and takes you to what you assume is her house. It has a modest brown exterior with a well-tended vegetable garden and a rusty but solid fence that comes up to the girl's hip. She opens the unassuming door, and what's behind it takes your breath away.

The inside is covered in beautiful floor-to-ceiling murals, and floor tiles create a beautiful mosaic of a setting sun over a lush valley. The overall effect takes your breath away; you had no idea entrance halls could be this gorgeous.

The kitchen is much the same, with some changes. The floor pattern seems to depict some sort of religious scene (you've never been religious; both of your parents are agnostic) that's just as beautiful as the entrance hall's. Every inch of the fridge is covered in photographs and children's art. All the smiling faces on the fridge make you a little homesick.

She fills a small, handmade dish with tap water and places it on the counter, then places you beside it. You lap at it eagerly, still feeling the aftereffects of last night's drinking. She slices up a mango, setting a small piece beside you and eating the rest slowly, still looking at you. She probably hasn't seen many three-inch men before.

After you finish your snack, she puts the dish in the sink, then sits back down at the beaten-up wooden table. She looks at you with a ___ expression.
12521.title: Necesito ayuda. ¿Hablas inglés?
